title: authordown
text: English README: README.md authordown 是一个用于管理作者信息并生成论文前置信息（尤其是大型作者列表题名页）的 R 包。

title: authordown
text: 题名页生成（机构编号、通讯作者标记） 作者信息校验与标准化 致谢、利益冲突与作者贡献部分 标准模板，统一作者数据录入 Shiny 应用用于快速预览与导出

title: authordown
text: CRAN（发布后）： GitHub：
code: install.packages("authordown") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("zh1peng/authordown")

title: authordown
text: 也可以写出一个新的模板到工作目录：
code: library(authordown)  # 使用包内置 CSV 模板 template_path <- system.file("extdata", "authordown_template.csv", package = "authordown") authors <- authordown_read_local(template_path) authordown_template("authors.csv")

title: authordown
code: title_page <- generate_title_page(   data = authors,   title = "Example Paper",   style = "default",   show_degree = TRUE ) cat(title_page)

title: authordown
code:
ack <- generate_acknowledgement(authors, style = "paragraph") coi <- generate_conflict(authors, style = "paragraph") contrib <- generate_contribution(authors, style = "bullets")  cat(ack) cat("

") cat(coi) cat("

") cat(contrib)

title: authordown
code: xlsx_path <- system.file("extdata", "authordown_template.xlsx", package = "authordown") authors_xlsx <- authordown_read_local(xlsx_path)

title: authordown
text: 如果你在在线表格中维护作者信息，建议导出到本地后再读取： 导出为 CSV 或 XLSX（也可 TSV） 使用 authordown_read_local() 读取本地文件 支持格式：CSV、TSV、XLSX。

title: authordown
text: 使用 Affiliation1, Affiliation2, … AffiliationN 列填写同一作者的多个机构。 没有硬上限，需要多少列就添加多少列。题名页会按首次出现的顺序编号。

title: authordown
text: 流程：下载模板 → 填写模板 → 上传 → 预览解析结果 → 生成输出并复制/导出。
code: library(shiny) shiny::runApp(system.file("shiny-app", package = "authordown"))

what: 渲染 HTML 以便复制粘贴
title: authordown
text: 如果需要渲染后的 HTML 便于粘贴到投稿系统，可使用：
code: \dontrun{ html_path <- render_section_html(   section_title = "Conflict of Interest",   content_function = generate_conflict,   data = authors,   style = "paragraph" ) }

title: authordown
text: “Missing required column” 表示文件缺少必填列（如 FirstName、LastName）。 “Corresponding authors must Email” 表示存在 Corresponding = TRUE 但 Email 为空。 “ORCID values must use 0000-0000-0000-0000 format” 表示 ORCID 格式错误。

title: authordown
text: AGPL-3

what: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
title: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
text: convenience wrapper calls various section generators combines one text block. Ideal quick copy-paste Word.

title: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
code: authordown(   data,   title = NULL,   style = "default",   show_degree = FALSE,   acknowledgement_style = "paragraph",   conflict_style = "paragraph",   contribution_style = "paragraph" )

title: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
text: data data frame columns needed function: generate_title_page, generate_acknowledgement, generate_conflict, generate_contribution. title Optional paper title pass generate_title_page(). style Title page style ("default", "APA", "Nature"). show_degree Logical. TRUE, include Degree author names. acknowledgement_style Output style acknowledgements. conflict_style Output style conflicts interest. contribution_style Output style contributions.

title: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
text: character string containing sections.

title: Generate all sections (title page, acknowledgement, conflict, contribution) — authordown
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ authors <- read.csv("authordown_template.csv") cat(authordown(authors, title = "My Great Paper", style = "default")) } # }

text: Reads CSV/TSV/XLSX file returns standardized data frame.

title: Read a local author metadata file — authordown_read_local
code: authordown_read_local(path, sheet = NULL, validate = TRUE)

title: Read a local author metadata file — authordown_read_local
text: path Path local CSV, TSV, XLSX file. sheet Optional sheet name index XLSX files. validate Logical. TRUE, validate data.

title: Read a local author metadata file — authordown_read_local
text: data frame standardized columns.

title: Read a local author metadata file — authordown_read_local
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ authors <- authordown_read_local("authors.csv") } # }

what: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
title: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
text: Copies standard author metadata template package requested path.

title: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
code: authordown_template(path = "authordown_template.csv", format = NULL)

title: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
text: path Output file path. Extension determines format format supplied. format Optional format override: "csv" "xlsx".

title: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
text: Invisibly returns output path.

title: Write an authordown input template — authordown_template
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ authordown_template("authors.csv") authordown_template("authors.xlsx") } # }

title: Validate author metadata — authordown_validate
text: Checks required columns key formats order, email, ORCID, corresponding author rules.

title: Validate author metadata — authordown_validate
code: authordown_validate(data, require_affiliations = FALSE)

title: Validate author metadata — authordown_validate
text: data data frame author metadata. require_affiliations Logical. TRUE, require least one affiliation column.

title: Validate author metadata — authordown_validate
text: validated, standardized data frame.

title: Validate author metadata — authordown_validate
code: authors <- data.frame(FirstName = "Alice", LastName = "Smith") authordown_validate(authors) #>   FirstName LastName #> 1     Alice    Smith

title: Generate an Acknowledgement Section — generate_acknowledgement
text: Combines acknowledgements author single formatted block.

title: Generate an Acknowledgement Section — generate_acknowledgement
code: generate_acknowledgement(data, style = c("paragraph", "bullets", "numbered"))

title: Generate an Acknowledgement Section — generate_acknowledgement
text: data data frame containing least column Acknowledgement. style Output style: "paragraph", "bullets", "numbered".

title: Generate an Acknowledgement Section — generate_acknowledgement
text: character string formatted acknowledgements.

title: Generate an Acknowledgement Section — generate_acknowledgement
code: authors <- data.frame(   FirstName = c("Alice", "Bob"),   LastName = c("Smith", "Johnson"),   Acknowledgement = c("Thanks for funding A", "Supported by XYZ"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) generate_acknowledgement(authors, style = "paragraph") #> [1] "Acknowledgements: Thanks for funding A; Supported by XYZ"

what: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
title: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
text: Produces readable conflict statement. authors report conflict, states . Otherwise, lists authors reporting conflicts indicates remaining authors declare conflict.

title: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
code: generate_conflict(data, style = c("paragraph", "bullets", "numbered"))

title: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
text: data data frame containing least columns: FirstName, LastName, Conflict. style Output style: "paragraph", "bullets", "numbered".

title: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
text: character string formatted conflict statement.

title: Generate a Conflict of Interest Statement — generate_conflict
code: authors <- data.frame(   FirstName = c("Alice", "Bob"),   LastName = c("Smith", "Johnson"),   Conflict = c("No conflict", "Consultant at Company Z"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) generate_conflict(authors, style = "paragraph") #> [1] "The following authors report conflicts of interest: Bob Johnson (Consultant at Company Z). All other authors (Alice Smith) declare no conflict of interest."

title: Generate Author Contributions — generate_contribution
text: Combines author's contribution statement clear paragraph. line indicates author specific contribution.

title: Generate Author Contributions — generate_contribution
code: generate_contribution(   data,   style = c("paragraph", "bullets", "numbered"),   list_style = NULL )

title: Generate Author Contributions — generate_contribution
text: data data frame containing least columns: FirstName, LastName, Contribution. style Output style: "paragraph", "bullets", "numbered". list_style Deprecated. Use style. provided, TRUE maps "bullets" FALSE maps "paragraph".

title: Generate Author Contributions — generate_contribution

title: Generate a Title Page — generate_title_page
code:
authors <- data.frame(   FirstName = c("Alice", "Bob"),   MiddleName = c("M.", ""),   LastName = c("Smith", "Johnson"),   Degree = c("PhD", "MD"),   Email = c("alice@example.com", "bob@example.com"),   Rank = c(1, 2),   Correspondence = c(TRUE, FALSE),   Affiliation1 = c("University of X, Dept. of Y", "University of X, Dept. of Y"),   Affiliation2 = c(NA, "Company Z, Research Division"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) generate_title_page(authors, style = "default", title = "Example Paper", show_degree = TRUE) #> [1] "## Example Paper

Alice M. Smith PhD^1^*, Bob Johnson MD^1,2^

1. University of X, Dept. of Y

2. Company Z, Research Division

*Corresponding author(s): alice@example.com"
